title: How to Factory Reset a Nespresso Vertuo: VertuoPlus, Lattissima, & More

steps.title: Plug in your machine and make sure it's turned on.
steps.content: Plug in your machine and make sure it's turned on. Ensure the indicator light is on and steady.

steps.title: Close the machine head.
steps.content: Close the machine head. Leave the handle in the "unlocked" position when you do so.

steps.title: Push the coffee button five times in three seconds to initiate a reset.
steps.content: Push the coffee button five times in three seconds to initiate a reset. If you did this correctly, the button will blink orange five times, then turn a steady white to indicate the reset is complete. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Push the lever on the front of the machine down for 3 seconds.
steps.content: Push the lever on the front of the machine down for 3 seconds. This will power your VertuoPlus machine down.

steps.title: Push the coffee button and the lever down at the same time for three seconds.
steps.content: Push the coffee button and the lever down at the same time for three seconds. After three seconds, you will see a steady orange light. This light signifies that your coffee machine has entered the special functions menu.

steps.title: Press the lever down three times to select a factory reset.
steps.content: Press the lever down three times to select a factory reset. If you let the machine idle the special functions menu, the light will blink three times every two seconds to let you know that you're still in special functions mode. If you don't choose a special function within two minutes, the machine will exit special functions mode.

steps.title: Push the coffee button to initiate the reset.
steps.content: Push the coffee button to initiate the reset. Once the reset is done the orange light will blink three times in three seconds, and then the light will change to green. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the machine head.
steps.content: Open the machine head. If there is a used pod inside, let it be ejected when you open the machine head.

steps.title: Close the machine head.
steps.content: Close the machine head. Leave the lever on the top of the machine in the unlocked position.

steps.title: Push the coffee button 5 times within 3 seconds to reset the machine.
steps.content: Push the coffee button 5 times within 3 seconds to reset the machine. If the reset was performed correctly, the button will slowly blink 5 times. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Plug in your machine and disconnect all accessories before turning it on.
steps.content: Plug in your machine and disconnect all accessories before turning it on. Remove the milk carafe and descaling pipe from your Lattissima before attempting a factory reset.

steps.title: Press and hold the hot foam button until the descale and rinse alerts start blinking.
steps.content: Press and hold the hot foam button until the descale and rinse alerts start blinking. Doing this will put your coffee machine in menu mode. If you don't make a selection within 15 seconds, your machine will exit menu mode.

steps.title: Press the hot foam button to enter reset mode, then press it again to start the reset.
steps.content: Press the hot foam button to enter reset mode, then press it again to start the reset. After the factory reset has been confirmed, all three milk recipe buttons will blink three times. [4] X Research source Once the milk recipe buttons have finished blinking, the machine has completed the factory reset and is now in ready mode.

steps.title: Plug in your machine and make sure it's turned on.
steps.content: Plug in your machine and make sure it's turned on. Compared to some other Vertuo models, resetting the Creatista is incredibly simple.

steps.title: Press and hold the milk temperature button for 10 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the milk temperature button for 10 seconds. All the lights will flash five times to indicate that the machine is reset. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Plug in your machine and make sure it's turned on.
steps.content: Plug in your machine and make sure it's turned on. Open the machine head.

steps.title: Close the machine head.
steps.content: Close the machine head. Leave the handle in the "unlocked" position when you do so.

steps.title: Push the coffee button five times in five seconds to initiate a reset.
steps.content: Push the coffee button five times in five seconds to initiate a reset. After doing this, the machine will be reset to factory settings and ready to use again. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open the machine head.
steps.content: Open the machine head. If there is a used capsule inside, let it be ejected when you open the machine head.

steps.title: Close the machine head.
steps.content: Close the machine head. Leave the lever on the top of the machine in the unlocked position.

steps.title: Push the power button 5 times within 3 seconds to reset the machine.
steps.content: Push the power button 5 times within 3 seconds to reset the machine. If the reset was performed correctly, the button will slowly blink 5 times. [7] X Research source
